verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329> upon <WH5921> Muth-labben, <WH4192> A Psalm <WH4210> of David. <WH1732> I will praise <WH3034> thee, O LORD, <WH3068> with my whole <WH3605> heart; <WH3820> I will show forth <WH5608> all <WH3605> thy marvelous works. <WH6381>
I will be glad <WH8055> and rejoice <WH5970> in thee: I will sing praise <WH2167> to thy name, <WH8034> O thou most High. <WH5945>
When mine enemies <WH341> are turned <WH7725> back, <WH268> they shall fall <WH3782> and perish <WH6> at thy presence. <WH4480> <WH6440>
For <WH3588> thou hast maintained <WH6213> my right <WH4941> and my cause; <WH1779> thou satest <WH3427> in the throne <WH3678> judging <WH8199> right. <WH6664>
Thou hast rebuked <WH1605> the heathen, <WH1471> thou hast destroyed <WH6> the wicked, <WH7563> thou hast put out <WH4229> their name <WH8034> forever <WH5769> and ever. <WH5703>

O thou enemy, <WH341> destructions <WH2723> are come to a perpetual end: <WH8552> <WH5331> and thou hast destroyed <WH5428> cities; <WH5892> their memorial <WH2143> is perished <WH6> with them. <WH1992>
But the LORD <WH3068> shall endure <WH3427> forever: <WH5769> he hath prepared <WH3559> his throne <WH3678> for judgment. <WH4941>
And he <WH1931> shall judge <WH8199> the world <WH8398> in righteousness, <WH6664> he shall minister judgment <WH1777> to the people <WH3816> in uprightness. <WH4339>
The LORD <WH3068> also will be <WH1961> a refuge <WH4869> for the oppressed, <WH1790> a refuge <WH4869> in times <WH6256> of trouble. <WH6869>
And they that know <WH3045> thy name <WH8034> will put their trust <WH982> in thee: for <WH3588> thou, LORD, <WH3068> hast not <WH3808> forsaken <WH5800> them that seek <WH1875> thee.
Sing praises <WH2167> to the LORD, <WH3068> which dwelleth <WH3427> in Zion: <WH6726> declare <WH5046> among the people <WH5971> his doings. <WH5949>
When <WH3588> he maketh inquisition <WH1875> for blood, <WH1818> he remembereth <WH2142> them: he forgetteth <WH7911> not <WH3808> the cry <WH6818> of the humble. <WH6035>

Have mercy <WH2603> upon me, O LORD; <WH3068> consider <WH7200> my trouble <WH6040> which I suffer of them that hate <WH4480> <WH8130> me, thou that liftest me up <WH7311> from the gates <WH4480> <WH8179> of death: <WH4194>
That <WH4616> I may show forth <WH5608> all <WH3605> thy praise <WH8416> in the gates <WH8179> of the daughter <WH1323> of Zion: <WH6726> I will rejoice <WH1523> in thy salvation. <WH3444>
The heathen <WH1471> are sunk down <WH2883> in the pit <WH7845> that they made: <WH6213> in the net <WH7568> which <WH2098> they hid <WH2934> is their own foot <WH7272> taken. <WH3920>

The LORD <WH3068> is known <WH3045> by the judgment <WH4941> which he executeth: <WH6213> the wicked <WH7563> is snared <WH3369> in the work <WH6467> of his own hands. <WH3709> Higgaion. <WH1902> Selah. <WH5542>
The wicked <WH7563> shall be turned <WH7725> into hell, <WH7585> and all <WH3605> the nations <WH1471> that forget <WH7913> God. <WH430>
For <WH3588> the needy <WH34> shall not <WH3808> always <WH5331> be forgotten: <WH7911> the expectation <WH8615> of the poor <WH6041> shall not perish <WH6> forever. <WH5703>
Arise, <WH6965> O LORD; <WH3068> let not <WH408> man <WH582> prevail: <WH5810> let the heathen <WH1471> be judged <WH8199> in <WH5921> thy sight. <WH6440>
Put <WH7896> them in fear, <WH4172> O LORD: <WH3068> that the nations <WH1471> may know <WH3045> themselves <WH1992> to be but men. <WH582> Selah. <WH5542>
